text: No, I don't have any portfolio. I am a total beginner in this industry.
I'm into modelling/sculpting and love to get stuck in

ahh ok good to know where we are at :slightly_smiling_face: so give me a brief overview of what it is you like about modelling that draws you to it vs the other subjects ? are you currently in any education to learn modeling ?
The creative aspect of modelling draws me in. I love the idea of creating something out of nothing. I am currentlly trying to teach myself and looking for online videos.
I'm experimenting, love to tap into 2D and 3D :slightly_smiling_face:
I'd love to CG model, not sure of the appropriate softwares and get really comfortable. Then eventually create a short animation portfolio that I can be proud of :slightly_smiling_face:

well this is a good starting point. better to not have bad habits to retrain. Your main momdeling softwares that you will use in a studio are maya, houdini and modo . I use modo so i can advise you best on that but the tools and methods are very similar across all of them so its no issue no matter what way you go. I would suggest getting a free trial on <http://pluralsight.com|pluralsight.com> and then download a trial of maya and modo. have a play with them for say the first half of your month trial , then we can discuss how you feel about the software and begin some more in depth stuff
Okay, sounds great! I'll do that. :slightly_smiling_face: Is there something I can do or make when I play around with those tools? Or should I focus on one first?
